item.description:
let's meetup at the beehive in boston's south end on saturday night, 14 march 2009, to hear a wonderful blues singer, toni lynn washington.

if you haven't been to the beehive, you should know that it's one of boston's most unique night spots, one serving up equally great food and music. since it opened in may 2007, the beehive has received uniformly rave press reviews; e.g., liza weisstuch wrote in the new york times sunday styles section: "boho in boston...the place is oozing with soul."

learn more about the beehive by visiting the official website.

if you haven't heard toni lynn washington before, check out her myspace page and listen to "I Don't Want Nobody" or "Unchain My Heart". you'll like what you hear.

some logistical notes:

there is often a line to get into the beehive, but the best way to avoid waiting in line is to make dinner reservations. if there's enough interest, i will make a dinner reservation, so when you rsvp please add a comment to say you're interested in joining us for dinner and indicate a time that works. i'll make the reservation mid-week and i'll do the best i can to accommodate everyone.

to get an idea of the dining possibilities, click here to see the beehive's menu.

street parking can be difficult to find, but there is a parking garage next door.

i'll email my cell number on friday at about 4 p.m. to everyone who has rsvp'd 'Yes' or 'Maybe' at that point. however, you'll be able to rsvp until saturday afternoon at 4 p.m., so if you want my cell number after friday, you can email me at gakable-meetup@yahoo.com and i'll email you the number.
item.how_to_find_us: i'll email my cell # to everyone who rsvps 'Yes' or 'Maybe' by friday, 4pm
item.name: Toni Lynn Washington @ The Beehive, Saturday, 14 March, 10 p.m.
